bug.short_desc: [modulecore] testCreateLink JUnit fails

long_desc.thetext: I've marked as blocking, since we can not declare M-build until this is addressed. (I will re-run tests to ensure not a spurious result, but doesn't seem like it would be, from reading the JUnit).

Oh, and here is stack dump from JUnit.
There should be exactly one Component resource with the source path "WebModule2/images".
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: There should be exactly one Component resource with the source path "WebModule2/images". at org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.componentcore.tests.ModuleCoreAPIFVTTest.testCreateLink(ModuleCoreAPIFVTTest.java:261) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:330) at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:204) at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.runTests(CoreTestApplication.java:35)

Well, the subsequenet test did pass, so changing this to 'normal'.
It's a bit unseteling this could be related to some lack of thread safety, so, appreciate any investigation/explainations that can be made without a reproducible case.
Thanks,
Carl- this is still occasionally failing... can you look into it?
Let's comment this test out for now, while we investigate the sporadic failures.

bug.short_desc: JavaScript error when expanding a RTE field

long_desc.thetext: Due to a timing issue, JavaScript error happens when expanding a RTE field if the machine is slow in loading the JavaScripts.
a fixe has been dlivered.
I do reproduce this problem on build 928 through a remote desktop connection. No such problem on build 1009
The fix was delivered in the 1006 build so 928 build (Sept. 28?) won't have it yet.
v,closed.

bug.short_desc: files with names legal on the remote system that are illegal on the host cause problems

long_desc.thetext:
- using dserver - on a unix target: create a file called "C:x.txt" - edit on a unix host: the local file is called "cx.txt" - file cannot be saved (You do not have write access on the file)
if you try to change the filename to "C:foo.txt" which is legal on the target, -> Error: "Name is not a valid file name" Details: "The name must be a valid file name within the workbench and the underlying file system."
if I rename it to Cx.txt that's ok, but there's a confusion in the display of the remote systems view (the full path is shown). Refresh fixes the problem.
See: http://www.scharf.gr/eclipse/rse/problems/invalid-remote-filenames/
That's particularly an issue for supporting VMS, where path names always include [];: characters
I see this as a not uncommon thing that I'd love to get fixed for 2.0.1.
Bulk update target milestone 2.0.1 -> 3.0

bug.short_desc: Remote shell commnd completion (Ctrl-Space) works only once

long_desc.thetext: - launch a remote-shell - type in a command - type in the first character of a file name - use the ctrl-space to expand a file name -->filename completion works nicely -> try ctrl-space again => it does not work anymore :-( ==> the only way to get it working (once) again is to actually disconnect and reconnect (even closing the shell and opening a new one does not work)
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 158766 ***

bug.short_desc: Universal action needed to locate a resource in the Remote Systems View

long_desc.thetext:
For resource in the "Remote System Details" view, the "Remote Monitor" view,the "Remote Shell" view, the "Remote Scratchpad", or even in the editor, it is *very* hard to locate them in the "Remote Systems" view. It would be great if there would be an universal action to locate the resource in the Remote Systems view.
There are some obvious problems, because a resource can be shown in multiple filters. There could be some kind of heuristics to locate the resouce. One is to remember where the resource came from. e.g. how did it end up on the editor, the system details or the monitor view (this would not work with resources in remote shells). Another heuristics could to find the first expanded that contains the resource.

This sounds like a very good suggestion at first sight (i.e. have something like "link with remote systems view", similar to "link with editor").
But on second sight I'm wondering WHY you'd want to locate a resource in the remote systems view? Any RSE View (Monitor, Details table, ...) should allow the same actions on the remote object, so there should be no need to locate it in another view.

Often I want to open another file that I know is in the same directory as the file I have currently in the editor.
- a script including another script - a related document in the same directory - ...

So that's a slightly different use-case then: "Link with Editor".
I'd suggest not inventing some new mechanisms for locating a resource in the remote systems view, but offer what the Platform already has: a button for "Link with Editor" in the Remote Systems view.

There already is a "link with editor" button in the Remote Systems view. The way I'm seeing this enhancement isn't quite the same, though. Seems to me that the idea is to, given a remote resource in a separate view (not editor), find that resource in the RSE tree.
Deferring to after 1.0 with P4

bug.short_desc: Unable to create display plug-in

long_desc.thetext:
first out of box installation of Microchip MPLAB on XP pro. MPLAB IDE launch from desktop icon displays messagebox "Unable to create the display plug-in..." And errors out. I suspect a problem rooted in Eclipse plug-in. Nothing unusual about this XP system: Compaq laptop, ATI Radeon 200M PCI Express VGA.
Background on MPLAB installation:
During installation of dsPICDEM.net 1.0 the driver pre-install worked OK, and the MPLAB ICD2 enumerated correctly in windows device manager, usb devices.
In step 2 I installed MPLAB. during system restart windows did a file system check and reported a "serious error"
Is there a way to check diagnose this outside of the MPLAB using an eclipse debugger?
TIA

This isn't a PDE UI problem. This is a product problem and we recommend you try seeking support for your product in the proper outlets.
If you want to learn about remote debugging in Eclipse, I recommend a google search.

bug.short_desc: Useless borders (Group) in Remote Shell

long_desc.thetext: Around each of the shells there is a group with a text "Command Shell - Running". This contains no information. Only RSE uses Groups "around" views. I'd suggest to remove it.
Kushal - please check with Dave on this one. Its probably really easy to fix, but also could be delayed.

See also bug 106018 for the remote monitor, and bug 160294 for an issue on Solaris that goes away when the border (group) is removed.
Bug 160294 has a patch attached that removes the border, but we dont currently have an idea how we could keep the "Running" / "Terminated" status info visible. Do we need this status info or could we do away with it because the shell is grayed out once its terminated anyway?
Correction: related bug is bug 160108, not 106018

There may be accessibility reasons for keeping the status text in the group box title. We should see if there is an alternative to displaying and reading this text, especially since getting rid of the group box appears to fix another bug on Solaris.
This has been fixed with bug 160294.
Closing as per RSE 1.0.

bug.short_desc: Useless borders (Group) in Remote Monitor -- show useful status

long_desc.thetext:
A similar problem as in bug 160107.
Around each of the monitors there is a group with a text repeating the tab title of the monitor . This contains no information. Only RSE uses Groups "around" views. I'd suggest to remove it, or replace it with an information string like in the "Remote Search" or other eclipse views, where some status information is shown: name of the container - number of files - filtered (sorry Subset) files
That would make sense. Actually the "Remote Systems Details" does it correctly (by showing a simple text string and not a Group border)

This seems a plain enhancement request which I'd rather see in the main stream than in the 2.0.1 service release. I'd like to keep 2.0.1 to (important, critical) bug fixes only in order to ensure it remains top stable.

bug.short_desc: Remote System Details view should show additional information in the text line above the table

long_desc.thetext: Remote System Details view should show additional information in the text line above the table. It should show: - the number of resources shown - the number of resources filtered (sorry the number of files selected ny the "Subset") - the filter (subset)

bug.short_desc: Totally hide the "Poll Configuration" in the Remote Monitor

long_desc.thetext:
The poll configuration widget in the Remote Monitor is a nice idea. This is very unusual within eclipse to have view controlling elements at the bottom. I can see why it is good for beginners, but even when collapsed it hides 1-2 row of the table
But it would be nice to totally remove it (e.g. by using a preference or a toggle button in the view tool bar). The information should also be available from the view menu and maybe a tool bar button.
I suggest using a toggle button in the tool bar to get rid of and display this. I also think this could be delayed until after release 1.
for now I'll collapse it by default. I'll revisit next release.

I don't think that collapsing by default is a good idea.
The default setting for poll configuration is not useful for most people, so they'll need to modify the poll config, so they'll need to expand it. Thus, better have it expanded right away.
So you think that people would normally poll?
Yes, because otherwise they'd use the Remote System Details view, wouldn't they?

Ultimately I think the Remote System Details view will be replaced with the Remote Monitor view anyway. See this defect:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=160118

This needs to be discussed. There are more differences between the Monitor and the Details view, e.g. single-instance vs. multiple-instance.
Deferring to after 1.0

Dave what kind of change are you planning for RC4? RC4 should be reserved for late-breaking major issues and doc fixes only.
Since this issue seems more a matter of personal preference, I'd rather defer it to the Future.
I wanted to bring it up before future because you commented about discussing this.

You mean comment #3? Yes it should not be collapsed by default. That would be an OK change for RC3. I was confused by the subject of this bug, so I'd prefer keeping this bug for "Future". I'd like a separate bug for not collapsing the poll configuration.

bug.short_desc: A blocking RSE job "hangs" the entire RSE system

long_desc.thetext:
I don't know exactly what I did, but suddenly I have a job called "Resolve filter stings (RSE Subsystem Operation:)" that does not want to end. Cancel did not help. Other RSE job (even on other subsystems) are waiting. A wait cursor is showed on all views.
See: http://scharf.gr/eclipse/rse/problems/blocking-job/

Created an attachment (id=51592) Thread dump of the blocking non cancelable job
Thread dump of the blocking non cancelable job

In the stack provided, the main thread uses SubSystem.scheduleJob(). That approach is a hack to be used in the old way of RSE queries - where deferred queries were not supported (there's a preference for this). The SystemTableTreeView (the one the monitor view uses) was still using the old approach to get at children, which is problemmatic. I've added support for deferred queries to that view now so that we avoid the main thread scheduleJob problem. I know that this won't address all cases of scheduleJob() but at least it will deal with the case described in the stack.
I'll leave this open so that it can be used on other problemmatic scheduleJob() scenarios if they're encountered.

This should be fixed now. All resolveFilterStrings methods that are called directly on main thread should no longer be using jobs. Also, I've taken out the readAndDispatch() that is used in the DStoreStatusMonitor - in normal cases, the waitForUpdate() should not be called on the main thread anyway.
SubSystem.scheduleJob still exists although the important cases should be avoiding it now (disconnect, connect and the resolveFilterStrings methods).
Reopen if these scenarios continue to occur with the fix.

attachment.desc: Thread dump of the blocking non cancelable job

bug.short_desc: Filter should allow to select containers (directories) only

long_desc.thetext:
It should be possible to show only the container hierarchy without the "file" nodes.
In addition, the Remote Monitor and the Remote System Details should then show the files.
Essentially, it should be possible to use RSE like the windows explorer.
That container-only selection is possible is shown in the "Remote Search"->"Browse for Folder" dialog.
Good idea. We'll look into this for the next release.
Need to investigate - Implementation not planned yet.

bug.short_desc: [filters] Define a query language for filters, e.g. OQL

long_desc.thetext:
A query language for filters would be helpful I'd suggest to use SQL syntax. This is well known and a well know standard. It would fit well into the "Tables" of RSE. The simple "Subset" semantics could be easily mapped to SQL.
I have a written small library (<3000 lines of code) that implements SQL (actually OQL) expressions. It is very easy to use.
If there's interest, we could contribute it to RSE.
Michael, it would be great if you'd consider contributing the OQL library.

Created an attachment (id=74547) Screenshot showing generic filters in Thunderbird
A UI for preparing filters in the generic filtering language could be like the one provided by Thunderbird if you do View > Customize... Add (see attached screenshot): Query conditions can be combined by AND and OR, each condition can select one field to check, and available checks are defined by the type of each field (is, contains, matches, ...)
This UI is simple to use and understand yet very powerful.

attachment.desc: Screenshot showing generic filters in Thunderbird

bug.short_desc: getDataType on ScalarParameterBean

long_desc.thetext:
Sometimes Developers need to manipulate the parameters depending on its datatype, for example DateTime parameters to open a calendar or long parameters to open a calculator...
ScalarParameterBean object that is used on XxxxParameterFragment.jsp should have this attribute in order to be used on JSP logic, also could be grate to get the locale format that will be used to parse the value.

In ScalarParameterBean, you can use getParameter() to get ParameterDefinition object. Any parameter definition, you can get them.(DataType...). About locale information, you can use BaseAttributeBean.getLocale() to get it.

The error message was : Unable to start subsystem factory Discovery This seems to be a configuration problem. One of the subsystems seems not to start...

Created an attachment (id=51594) A patch that fixes the problem
One corrupt subsystem should not cause the entire system to fail. (I tried the patch on the running system using the debugger hotswap capabilities)

Here's how I debugged the running eclipse: http://michaelscharf.blogspot.com/2006/10/tip-debug-and-patch-at-runtime.html
And a flash demo (ok flash demos is my new toy, I can't resist ;-): http://www.scharf.gr/eclipse/tips/debug-a-running-eclipse/
Dave - not being able to create filters is a major issue. Since a patch is attached, we should look at this ASAP, thus I've set it to P1.

The problem is no longer reproducable with I20061007-1903 (supposedly since discovery was fixed for that build). Lowering severity and priority but not marking fixed, since there still is an issue with corrupt subsystems destabilizing the entire system. The patch should be considered.

I just tried it with I20061007-1903 and I get exactly the same exceptions....
A general policy with extensions is: a misbehaving extension should not impact the stability of the rest of the system. Whenever code 'talks' to extensions it should assume that the extensions do not behave well...

Can you please do "Help > About Eclipse > Configuration Details > Copy to Clipboard", then paste into a file and attach the file with your config.
I suspect that the "discovery" plugin you are using is still old and not from I20061007-1903.
Added the check for a null subsystem configuration when resolving a proxy.

bug.short_desc: fastxpath.jar cannot be used standalone for XPath filtering

long_desc.thetext:
To implement the GLA sensor filtering feature 141840 in 4.3 XPath filtering is used. The TPTP Fast XPath support was used for this. However, when GLA runs outside the eclipse environment fastxpath.jar from org.eclipse.tptp.platform.models is required on the classpath but fastxpath.jar has dependencies on other classes in the models plugin that are not included in this jar. For GLA's usage of fastxpath.jar (FastXPathAPI), the only dependency is the org.eclipse.hyades.models.hierarchy.util.ModelDebugger class and in particular when ModelDebugger.INSTANCE.debug is used to test whether debugging is enabled. This class is used in the org.eclipse.tptp.platform.provisional.fastxpath.FastXPathAPI and org.eclipse.tptp.platform.provisional.jre14.fastxpath.FastXPathEngine classes. If the debugging code is removed from these classes, then GLA can use fastxpath.jar for its filtering outside eclipse.
This change is required in 4.3 so GLA can use fastxpath.jar in stand-alone mode.
Is this a regression, Dave?
This is not a regression. The debugging code was added at the end of the 4.2 development cycle. This problem was found while creating testcases for the sensor filtering in the standalone GLA case.

Dave, I suggest to update the fastxpath.jar with src-hierarchy folder included. I don't think removing debug points from code is the solution, as it's used by multiple locations and it will for sure to be consumed more extensively in the future. The footprint increase for fastxpath.jar is about 900kb. Is this okay with you?

As discussed with Dave, I moved ModelDebugger and IdentityHashSet classes to a new src-utils folder and new packages, and FastXPath.jar and tptp-model.jar include the new src-folder. Patch to be attached.
Created an attachment (id=51882) patch
patch submitted to HEAD (4.3i2)

bug.short_desc: Unify Remote Monitor and Remote System Details

long_desc.thetext:
Both views do essentially the same. The only difference is the the Remote Monitor can poll for updates automatically and the Remote System Details can be locked.
And a few menu entries of the Remote System Details are missing in the Remote Monitor.
The unlocking of the Remote System Details could be one special monitor (well a good UI idea is needed here)
Else I see no reason why the two views are separate.
Yeah, I think we should ultimately get rid of the remote system details view, bringing whatever features make sense to the monitor view.

This needs to be discussed. There are more differences between the Monitor and the Details view, e.g. single-instance vs. multiple-instance.
Deferring to after 1.0
I think we should get rid of the Remote Systems Details view (in favour of the Monitor view) before we complete RSE 2.0. Any thoughts on this?
With all the bugs I've been opening on Remote System Details View it would be a good idea to decide on whether or not the Remote System Details View is going to stay or be removed.
Martin, do you think it's too late in the cycle to address this one?
We've mostly been testing the Tableview and not so much the Monitor lately. I'd rather keep it as is for 2.0. I think we've got more urgent stuff to get done.

bug.short_desc: Add the Remote Search inline expanding of archive files to the Remote System Monitor and the Remote System Details view

long_desc.thetext: It is very cool that archives (like zip files) can be expanded in the remote search results. This should be possible in the System Monitor and the Remote System Details as well.
You should be able to expand in the system monitor as well as the remote system details views. Are you finding this not working?
The monitor view does not allow expansion of nodes in the view. The System Details view does and it looks like it is working for archives.

bug.short_desc: [Forms] Hyperlink's font gets disposed during the application runtime

long_desc.thetext:
From time to time I get this weird exception:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Argument not valid at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3358) at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3297) at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3268) at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC.setFont(GC.java:2920) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.widgets.Hyperlink.paintText(Hyperlink.java:177) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.widgets.Hyperlink.paintHyperlink(Hyperlink.java:165) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.widgets.AbstractHyperlink.paint(AbstractHyperlink.java:265) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.widgets.AbstractHyperlink$2.paintControl(AbstractHyperlink.java:72) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:83) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:1085) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:1109) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:1094) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.gtk_expose_event(Control.java:2024) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.gtk_expose_event(Composite.java:605) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas.gtk_expose_event(Canvas.java:133) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.windowProc(Widget.java:1430) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.windowProc(Display.java:3796) at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS._gtk_main_do_event(Native Method) at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.gtk_main_do_event(OS.java:5245) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.eventProc(Display.java:1133) at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS._g_main_context_iteration(Native Method) at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.g_main_context_iteration(OS.java:1427) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2838) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1914) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:1878) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:419) at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:149)
My Eclipse config is attached.
Created an attachment (id=51596) My Eclipse config.
punting to the father of Forms

The hyperlink color management is currently flawed in that it borrows the colors from JFaceColors (which delegates to ColorRegistry), and hangs onto these Color objects. These colors can be disposed when the setting changes via the preference page. We need to somehow add ourselves as resource listeners for these colors. However, I would hate adding each hyperlink group as a listener to the color registry. We need to carefully fix this one.
Can you clarify 'from time to time'? Is there a repeatable sequence of steps that causes this exception to be thrown?

Nope... I have a FormEditor with multiple FormPage's, when moving between tabs - it happens occasionally, with no reproduction scenario. My workaround was: to change the type of Section to non-expandable.

A disposed font is being answered by getFont(), so the font that was previously set into your Canvas subclass has been prematurely disposed bby someone while it's still being used.
Using a small test snippet it appears that in this scenario getFont() will not answer a disposed font on win32, so there is a platform difference here that makes your scenario not fail on win32. However this behaviour is not spec'd and cannot be counted on.
Returning report to UA since disposing a font that is still in use is never valid.

bug.short_desc: TPTP and BIRT blocks automatic updates in eclipse

long_desc.thetext:
Automatic updates does not work in eclipse since I installed TPTP. I get errors like #BIRT Reporting for TPTP Feature (4.2.0.v200606131519--1G955G5G7A7E7M) requires plug-in "org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.xml" when I run automatic updates in eclipse.
It actually stops all automatic updates even if TPTP or BIRT is not included in the update or installation. I cant install anything.
I have installed BIRT but version 2.1 does not include org.eclipse.birt.core. I installed some earlier version but now it cant find org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.xml even if I have installed the version from BIRT 2.0.1 (org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.xml_2.0.1).
NOTE: BIRT was not installed at all when this problem started. I only installed it because of this error.
I use eclipse 3.2 and BEA Workshop for JSP (3.2.0)

Can you let me know what has been installed in your eclispe, and how did you install them? If you installed TPTP using updater, did you use the Callisto updater, or the TPTP update site?
If you see a message saying a plugin is not available, that means you have a dependency of TPTP not available.
Also, note that you only need to install BIRT if you are installing the TPTP-BIRT integration feature. TPTP 4.2.1 requires BIRT 2.1.1. You should not install BIRT 2.0.x with TPTP 4.2.1.
The easiest way to get all necessary dependencies is to use the Callisto updater: http://download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/site.xml Simply select TPTP, and click the "Select Required" button.
I'm marking this bug as "works for me". Please reopen this bug if you are still have problems with the updater, and provide me with details I asked for in my previous comment. Thanks.

I just copied the files in the TPTP delivery to the eclipse folder. I did not have a separate BIRT installation when the problem started. When I installed different versions of BIRT the error message changed. It suddenly found the missing dependeny (for example org.eclipse.birt.core) but then another dependeny was missing. org.eclipse.birt.core is not part of BIRT 2.1.1
I have eclipse and BEA workshop installed.
Why does TPTP update require dependencies no longer included in BIRT? I get the same error with http://download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/site.xml
Why does this problem stop all other updates, even if I uncheck TPTP in the update I get this error?
I have chosen to disable updates for now. Maybe someone else has experienced the same problem and will raise this issue again.

org.eclipse.birt.core is part of BIRT 2.1.1. I verified in birt-report-framework-2_1_1.zip. The plugin is a jar file: eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.birt.core_2.1.1.v20060926-0959.jar
The update manager won't install new updates if there are configuration problems already in the workbench. That's why you see the updater won't install anything.
I'm still not sure what caused the problem. If you unzipped TPTP 4.2.1, EMF and XSD 2.1.1 and BIRT 2.1.1 and WTP 1.5.1, then you will have everything required by TPTP.
To debug the problem, can you give me the error message you get in the updater? It should tell you which feature is missing by which feature. Also, from the eclispe menu, select Help > Software Updates > Manage Configuration. In the "Product Configuration" window, expand the navigation tree on the left. If there are problems with the current configuration, you will see red crosses on the features with problems. If you see errors and don't know how to fix them, please let me know.
I have reopened the bug to track this problem a little longer.

I have reduced the severity from blocker to normal, because I am sure the updater works, at least for most scenarios.
Hans, please let me know if you have any progress on this problem.
Hans, haven't heard from you for a long time. I assume your problem has been resolved. Please reopen the bug if you still need help from me. Thanks.

bug.short_desc: [Wizard] Model element names missing from graphical definition wizard

long_desc.thetext:
Using latest callisto release of Eclipse/EMF/GMF, as of 09/07/2006. Following the mindmap example cheat sheet, step "Create a graphical definition", while in the Graphical Definition wizard.
In the last step of the wizard, where diagram element and domain model elements to process are to be selected, the model element names are not displayed, which makes it impossible to follow the cheat sheet step 3 :"uncheck all but the 'Topic' element as a node, its 'name' attribute as a label, and the 'subtopics' relationship as a link"
The wizard becomes impossible to complete.

I just installed a clean Eclipse 3.2.1. and GMF 1.0.1 from the Callisto update site. I made it past the point you mention without trouble, so perhaps you have a configuration issue, or an invalid model file?
Also, did you check the error log for problems?
I did the wizard again, and the model element names are displayed only when the wizard is not invoked from the cheat sheet. If the wizard is invoked from the cheat sheet, the names are not displayed.

Labels and images are provided by .edit plugin generated by EMF. Most likely you've messed up with .edit plugin. EMF does not regenerate plugin.xml and manifest files of this plugin so item providers may not be registered properly. Try to delete .edit plugin of your model and regenerate it.

(In reply to comment #3) I did not modify the .edit plugin (I did not even give look at it yet). The problem occurs when following the cheat sheet. When the Graphical Definition wizard is invoked by clicking on the link in the cheat sheet, it displays the cheat sheet on the side, but the labels on the tree are not displayed.
I rechecked the process, and i noticed that the problem the first column (containing names) resized to zero when the cheat sheet is active. When I enlarge the column and then resize the window, then the first column shrinks again to the size of zero. The bug also occurs when resizing the window when the cheat sheet is not used. It is not such major a bug as I indicated when opening the bug, but it is very annoying for someone who would resize the window to improve visibility and not realize that the names column was simply resized.

bug.short_desc: In Product Configuration, "Show Properties" is displayed at two items selected in the right tree

long_desc.thetext: In Product Configuration, "Show Properties" is displayed at two items selected in the right tree. "Show Properties" is't displayed at thtee items selected in the right tree.

I examined this problem. The problem is in the listener registration order.
In createPartControl method of org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.views.ConfigurationView class, two methods are executed.
(1) createTreeViewer(leftContainer); In this method, execute treeViewer.addSelectionChangedListener. (2) makeActions(); In this method, new PropertyDialogAction( ... ).
As a result, SelectionChanged event is executed in following order. : ConfigurationView.handleSelectionChanged method : PropertyDialogAction.selectionChanged method :
The information string of right pain is made and set by the execution of ConfigurationView.handleSelectionChanged method.
To solve it; treeViewer.addSelectionChangedListener is executed after (2).

Verified still a problem in build i20061010.
- Help -> Manage Configuration - Select a single feature or location - Note "Show Properties" appears as an option in the right-hand pane - Multi-select a second feature or location - Note that "Show Properties" still appears - Multi-select a third feature or location - Note that "Show Properties" disappears - ctrl-click so now 2 things are selected - Note that "Show Properties" still isn't there

bug.short_desc: can't include files from parent directories

long_desc.thetext:
Phoenix usage questions should be asked on the eclipse.technology.phoenix newsgroup ;-)
But since I'm here...
Includes are relative to the filesystem, and for security reasons, our PHP doesn't allow to open URLs.
Uour include should be as such: include $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'] . "/equinox/global-links.html";
This will translate to the physical path of the file, relative to the web server's root.

long_desc.thetext: I'll attached a test case that represents a simplified version of the problem that I'm having in the org.eclipse.emf.ecore plugin. This problem is a show stopper for me. I.e., I cannot get a downstream class to compile because of this.

Created an attachment (id=51602) Two projects that demonstrate the problem.
Often the problem shows up just in B class of project a. I.e., this error appears:
The type org.example.a.A$Entry.Internal cannot be resolved. It is indirectly referenced from required .class files a/src/org/example/a B.java line 0 1160248111755 1939091
If I modify B (add space and remove) and save it, the error goes away, and if I do it again, the error comes back. The same error occurs in project b, and in this case there is nothing I can do to make the error go away.
This same type of problem occurs when I templatize org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.FeatureMap and then try to use FeatureMap.Entry.Internal in the org.eclipse.emf.ecore.change model, so I'm very anxious to get this working...
Smells like a buildpath issue.

bug.short_desc: Bundle.getEntry and Class.getResource differ in PDE-runtime, but not in export

long_desc.thetext:
Bundle.getEntry() and Class.getResource() have different behaviours when running under the PDE runtime workbench, but have the same behaviour when running as an exported plugin. That's because of the difference in the way files are stored in the project root when Eclipse runs; instead of everything being stored under the .classpath output folder(s), the bundle's contents are deemed to be the contents of the project as a whole. When it's exported, it has no such difference; the bundles contents are the resources of the bundle (assuming that the bundle's classpath is . of course).
This would be fixed by bug 153023.

bug.short_desc: ECF IInvitationListener should be on IChatRoomManager rather than IChatRoomContainer

long_desc.thetext: The method addInvitationListener(IInvitationListener) should be added to the IChatRoomManager interface. Probably also need to add a method to allow IChatRoomContainer instances to be created via the IChatRoomManager. e.g. IChatRoomManager.createChatRoomContainer().

I think IChatRoomContainers should be able to get its corresponding IRoomInfo (as it certainly exposes a lot of handy public methods that providers will want to leverage) if an IRoomInfo can create/get its corresponding IChatRoomContainer.
I think a getIRoomInfo method would be better than using adapters, if we were to go this route.
Fixed in refactoring done 10/19/2006. Will be in 0.9.3 stable.

bug.short_desc: @extends does not endure code formatting

long_desc.thetext: When an interface @extends another interface, regenerating the model gives incorrect code when the code has been formatted before. In the following model: the c.java has been changed to /** * * A representation of the model object 'c'. * @extends Comparable * * * * @see p.PPackage#getc() * @model * @generated */ public interface c extends EObject, Comparable { } // c it extends an other interface now. When c.java is reformatted, with my formatting settings this results in /** * A representation of the model object 'c'. * * @extends Comparable * * * @see p.PPackage#getc() * @model * @generated */ public interface c extends EObject, Comparable { } // c When the the model code is regenerated again this results in public interface c extends EObject, Comparable, { Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF) Version: 2.2.0.v200606051102 Build id: 200606051102

For the time being, you can probably avoid this issue by adding a dummy line like this * * A representation of the model object 'c'. * @extends Comparable * @ * Maybe even this would work. * * @extends Comparable * A representation of the model object 'c'. * You can also configure the formatting options not to format the Javadoc. I'll change the severity to minor to reflect that there are simple ways to avoid this.
The pattern in emf-merge.xml has been changed to consider <!-- the end of the meaningful text.

Forgot to mention -javaagent is used for weaving

As discussed in the bug you reference, the fix/workaround is probably the same - to avoid weaving the CGLIB generated files by using something like:
<exclude within="*CGLIB*"/>
in your aop.xml file.

Thank you, workaround I have already (it is specific for application), but would give a try to your suggestion anyway.
But it would be very nice if bug will be fixed soon.

Neither <weaver> <exclude within="*CGLIB*" /> <include within="de.ntec..*" /> </weaver> nor <weaver> <include within="de.ntec..*" /> <exclude within="*CGLIB*" /> </weaver> works. Include I really need as there are a lot of other classes that I do not wont to weave (all JDK , Spring, Hibernate ...).
But this works <include within="de.ntec..*" /> <exclude within="de.ntec.lms.impl.topology.*CGLIB*" /> Sorry for flooding.

Have you tried using a recent development build of AspectJ? There have been a lot of bugs fixed since the 1.5.2 code came out (on which 1.5.2a is based). It would be helpful to know if this bug has been fixed already or not.

The CGLIB generated code is not suitable for our weaving strategy - as discussed in the other bug, it contains some incorrect stack manipulation which AspectJ makes 'visible' when the code is woven. I don't plan on changing our weaving strategy any time soon. The CGLIB guys said they would take a patch for the problem if anyone cared to write it - then code they created would work fine with AspectJ.
No, I have not, never use development builds for development. May try just to clarify if bug is fixed. Would inform about results.

Hello,
recent development build (aspectj-DEVELOPMENT-20061005121113.jar) exibits exactly the same behavior.
Concerning CGLIB - in other bug discussin was stated not that CGLIB makes incorrect stack manipulation that AspectJ, in turn, makes visible, but that CGLIB make some unusual but perfectly legal stack manipulation that AspectJ is not prepared for.
Anyway, I have to agree that weaving of proxies is usually not so great idea, so excluding of CGLIB generated classes from weaving is a correct solution for most cases - the only thing that, IMHO, it shall be documented outside of bug-tracking system, e.g. in AspectJ FAQ (faq.html delivered with AspectJ).
Regards,
Oleksandr

Yes - could put something in the FAQ on this, or compiler limitations section of the doc.
I shouldn't have used the word 'incorrect' earlier - I should have said "unusual". AspectJ doesn't expect two exit points from a method to have different stack heights - so when they are merged to travel through a single after advice, the stack heights are discovered to be inconsistent on arrival at the advice call. The fix to include multiple after advice sections would take a lot of work - and given that you usually don't want to weave these things - I have not done this work.
As soon as it find its way into documentation it would be absolutely Ok.
check in this timeframe if cglib have resolved the problem that causes this

bug.short_desc: Some pages make search engines loop indefinitely

long_desc.thetext:
Every day I need to manually kill our search indexer because it gets caught in an infinite loop either on the categories pages or on the articles pages:
http://www.eclipse.org/index.php/org/org/org/org/org/categories/categories/org/org/org/org/org/org/org/org/categories/org/categories/categories/categories/org/org/org/categories/org/categories/categories/rcp.php http://www.eclipse.org/index.php/org/org/categories/org/org/categories/org/categories/categories/categories/categories/org/org/org/org/categories/categories/org/categories/org/org/categories/org/org/org/org/articles http://www.eclipse.org/index.php/org/org/org/org/org/categories/categories/categories/org/categories/categories/categories/categories/org/org/categories/org/org/org/org/categories/categories/org/org/org/org/categories/categories/org/cate http://www.eclipse.org/index.php/org/org/org/org/org/categories/categories/categories/org/categories/categories/categories/categories/org/org/categories/org/org/org/org/categories/categories/org/org/org/org/categories/categorie
The same thing happens with the articles section, so I'm wondering if there's something up with the form, ir with the "filter" boxes that makes it generate never-ending URLs from ../ things.
I'll investigate further to add more details.
D.
Peeking in the database reveals there are 80408 indexed pages that contain "org/org" in the URL

I found the culprit. On this page: http://www.eclipse.org/org/councils/roadmap_v2_0/PC_v2_0/index.php
There is an incorrect link to: http://www.eclipse.org/index.php/RestructureGenericServerSupportProposal
Which causes the home page to come up with a useless /RestructureGenericServerSupportProposal at the end of the URL. The homepage then has a "More about Eclipse" link which is relative: org/, which then replaces index.php/RestructureGenericServerSupportProposal with index.php/org/.
The whole thing spirals out of control as index.php/org/ (the home page) has a relative link to "org/", becoming index.php/org/org. Lather, rinse, repeat.
I propose we change the relative org/ link to an absolute /org/ on the home page, and we fix the broken link on the Councils roadmap page.
Moving to Community/Website

bug.short_desc: allow multiple uninstalls or disables at once

long_desc.thetext: The Product Configuration page allows selecting multiple features at once, but only uninstalls or disables one at a time. The cycle to uninstall is moderately time-consuming, even without a restart. (It includes reloading all the features, for example). It seems to be simple and very handy to allow uninstalls (or disables) of multiple features in one step.
or multiple enables at once
Indeed. Especially since the right frame changes on multiple selections (so it's context sensitive) but only the first selected entry will be uninstalled.
+1, this makes the dialog fairly unusable when you have to disable or remove a number of features.

bug.short_desc: [j2ee] No source/javadoc attachments for J2EE Module Dependencies

long_desc.thetext:
There is no way to associate source and javadoc to libraries associated with a web project via the J2EE configuration.
This is a problem for those who want to use the web tools server launching / module deployment but don't want to keep their jars in WEB-INF/lib on the file system (or more importantly, version control)... a very common scenario I would think.
I really think there's an opportunity to rework how simple web-app (.war producing) projects manage their jar dependencies. It doesn't seem as clear and intuitive as it could be (consider the competition's handling of this). I think the fact that "Web App Libraries" storing of javadoc/source in a non standard location (see #159838) is also a sign that maybe things could be handled more consistently.

If I have made an error pleasae reset target and set priority appropriately.
The code needed to fix this will be essentially the same as needed for bug 159838. However, since this is not exactly the same this is not being duplicated.

bug.short_desc: [CommonNavigator] Actions not synched with selection

long_desc.thetext:
There's a problem when making actions with the common navigator framework. Strangely, it is only reproduceable when the 'Java Elements' is not used in the content provider -- I've seen it happen when trying an example only with the resources provider.
To reproduce it, go to the Project Explorer, uncheck the 'Java Elements', select any resource, then press up/down to select another resource and quickly press delete (or F2, or some other action). Here what happens is that the delete will work on the resource that was previously selected and not on the new selected resource (so, the action seems to be unsynchronized with the actual selection -- made me delete a whole source folder instead of a single file -- that's why I'm marking it as critical).

It sounds like you were faster than the update to the registered actions. Currently this happens using a post selection change listener, to ensure that for cases where you scroll quickly using arrows, there isn't a noticeable delay.
Are there specific actions you've seen this with? (F2 and Delete, are there others?)
The problem seems isolated to the resource change actions; a different set of actiosn take over when the Java Elements extension is enabled.

All the actions... ctrl+c, ctrl+v, etc. -- but as you said, if you slow down, this doesn't happen -- so, being slower is a good thing in this case ;-)
Cheers,
Fabio
We have seen a similar issue in Team (bug 163078).

Converted the Navigator Action Service to a Selection Changed Listener.
Fixed and released for > 20070501_2300.

bug.short_desc: NPE when using crossrefs option for iajc ant task

long_desc.thetext: There is a bug here - it shouldn't crash. But crossrefs is a very old option - are you sure it is what you want to use? If you want an information on what was woven where, use '-showWeaveInfo'. The crossrefs option produces an emacs compatible ajsym file that is never used by anything other than emacs...

-crossrefs is similar to -emacssym in that they are both a way to cause the compiler to generate a structure model and relationships map outside of AJDT (command line or through Ant). I can make the command line compiler fail with something as easy as:
ajc -crossrefs -inpath x.jar
the problem is that we don't initialize the output location correctly for the crossrefs option (and so NPE). The workaround is to supply an output directory, so this works:
ajc -crossrefs -inpath x.jar -d output
In the example Ant script here, the output location is a jar and nothing in the -crossrefs processing understands jar locations as the output destination.
Are you planning to use the AspectJ classes to parse this serialized object yourself?

the fix is in - we will no longer NPE. However, if outjar is used, we won't put the .ajsym file into the output jar - that would be a new enhancement request I think. As I mentioned previously, to see the result of weaving it is best to use showWeaveInfo - or if you want to post-process the weaving messages then supply your own message handler and you can do whatever you like with the messages as they come out.
The -showWeaveInfo option shows me what I need, so I can use that. Thanks for your help.

Ron Bodkin pointed me at this report. It made me wonder if we should be putting the .ajsym file, or something equivalent, into the META-INF directory of JARs that should expose crosscutting structure. But as you point out Andy, that would be a separate enhancement request.
nothing further to do for this bug - the final comments refer to what would be a future enhancement that has yet to be requested...

bug.short_desc: The "add dependencies" link should ignore DynamicImport-Package header

long_desc.thetext:
When using the manifest editor, the Automated Management of Dependencies section's "add dependencies" link should always ingore the DynamicImport-Package header when computing the Import-Package list.
The thinking here is that the Import-Package list should be accurate per the static dependencies that can be calculated for the bundle at development time.
When the DynamicImport-Package header exists, static dependencies that match the DynamicImport-Package value/wildcard are never added to the Import-Package list. This is particularly true when "DynamicImport-Package: *" is used and nothing is ever added to the Import-Package list.
Section 3.6.3 of the R4 spec describes the DynamicImport-Package header as follows:
Dynamic Imports The DynamicImport-Package header is intended to look for an exported package when that package is needed. The key use case for dynamic import is the Class forName method when a bundle does not know in advance the class name it may be requested to load.
Although the way that the PDE behaves today is not technically wrong, it is certainly confusing and misleading.
The packages on which the bundle depends, that can be statically computed at development time, should always be added to the Import-Package list, regardless of the value of the DynamicImport-Package header.
While I've not tested this on 3.2.1, this could have been fixed by bug 139261, but it is unlikely. Nevertheless these bugs seem to be closely related.

Seems like a reasonable request :)
Fixed in HEAD, will be available in 3.3M3
How great it is not to have to argue my corner for a change. Nicely done, Brian. <g>

bug.short_desc: Moving lots of files does not run as background job

long_desc.thetext:
Moving lots of files from one folder to another on a slow connection shows a modal dialog during the move. Eclipse cannot be used during the time of moving.
The move should run in a background job instead.

I guess the problem with moving in background is, that either the resource views are either inconsistent while the move is going on, or tons of events are being sent to update while the move is going on.
In each case, the system will be hard to use.
I guess what's needed is sort of a "workspace lock" on the remote system resources while the move is going on in background, such that Eclipse IDE can be used while the move is going on, but any changes to remote resources on the connection being affected are forbidden while it is locked. Once the operation is completed, the lock can be given up and a single update event can be sent.

bug.short_desc: Export Deployable plug-ins and fragments is failing

long_desc.thetext:
To reproduce:
1. File->New->Project->Plug-in Project. 2. Name the project "test" and click Next. 3. Click Next again and select Hello, World. 4. Click Finish 5. File->Export->Deployable plug-ins and fragments 6. Select the plugin and a destination directory. 7. Click Finish
An error dialog pops up with the following message:
"Problems during export
Reason: Unable to find plug-in: test_0.0.0. Please check the error log for more details."
Is it a regression of bug 128598?
Is there a workaround for this problem?

This seems to be working for me in 3.2.1 (and latest from HEAD). I downloaded 3.2.1 to my linux machine, stated a new workspace, followed steps 1-7 and the plugin jar was created successfully without any errors. I then changed my target platform environment to windows (similar to bug 128598), and repeated the export. Again, I had no errors and everything was exported correctly. Lastly, I tried deselecting the "Package plug-ins as individual JAR archives" option and exported again. No errors were displayed and the plugin was exported correctly.
Are there any other configuration issues you can think of that might be causing this problem?

It was something bad in the workspace. The export started working after I switched to a fresh workspace. Would be nice to have a better diagnostics for this error though. The reference to the error log is misleading since nothing gets written there.

bug.short_desc: DomainNotifier violates loader constraints

Can you please Help > About > Configuration Details, Copy&Paste it into a file and attach the config?

I just realized that ssomething was wrong with my configuration: I removed all *rse* plugins and installed the latest drop (+ the examples and experimental plugins). The problem is gone now....
I still have the buggy configuration around, if that helps.

Hm, weird.
If you have time, it might be helpful if you could do 'Help > About Eclipse > Configuration Details > Copy to Clipboard", paste into a file and attach it to this bug for both the working and the failing configuration.

bug.short_desc: dstore files properties connector service causes a class cast exception

long_desc.thetext:
Using I20061007-1903. When I open the properties of the Files subsystem of a dstore connector and select the Services page, I get a class cast exception:
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.rse.services.dstore.files.DStoreFileService at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.servicesubsystem.FileServiceSubSystemConfiguration.getFileService(FileServiceSubSystemConfiguration.java:54) at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.servicesubsystem.FileServiceSubSystemConfiguration.getService(FileServiceSubSystemConfiguration.java:49) at org.eclipse.rse.ui.widgets.services.FactoryServiceElement.getService(FactoryServiceElement.java:67) a
This should hopefully be a simple fix.

That's odd. I can't reproduce this. The line of code in the stack with the exception is this:
IFileService service = (IFileService)_services.get(host);
The thing is DStoreFileService is an IFileService:
public class DStoreFileService extends AbstractDStoreService implements IFileService, IUniversalDataStoreConstants
So I'm not sure why this exception would occur.
It was probably a configuration error (I had some old rse plugins in my installation)...

bug.short_desc: [API]DataSetID.toString() should return null but return "null"

Expected result: null.
Actual result: "null"

add javadoc to describe the behavior: DataSetID(parent, rowId, subQueryName) 1. parent data set can't be null. 2. subquery name can't be null. 3. throws out an IlleageArgumentException for null arguments.
DataSetID(queryName) 1. queryName can't be null, otherwise through out an exception.
Fixed.
Verified and close it

bug.short_desc: Product export doesn't support features with ".qualifier"

long_desc.thetext:
3.3 M2
I have a feature with a version string "1.0.1.qualifier". I can export this feature via "File -> Export... -> Deployable features" and the ".qualifier" gets replaced with a computed qualifier.
However if I try to export via "File -> Export... -> Eclipse product" using a product configuration that includes the feature the export fails without any error, i.e. nothing is logged in the error log and the created zip contains just one feature out of the many referenced in the product configuration. I assume this is because the underlying build fails somewhere.
If I remove the ".qualifier" from the feature version the export works fine.

I just noted that the problem is different. The .product file contains a hard reference to a specific feature version. But there is no option in the UI to edit the feature version. I had to open the product configuration in the text editor to update the feature version.
I also noticed that a version seems to be required. Specifying "0.0.0" doesn't work either.
Checking the box "Synchronize product configuration" is not an option because this removes some additional information from my product extension definition in the plugin.xml (related to branding images, see bug 134395 and bug 134396) for background info.

Hi Gunnar, any chance you can try this again with 3.3M6?
I created RCP mail template plugin (version 1.0.0.qualifier). Then create a feature (version 1.0.0.qualifier) that contained the plug-in. Lastly, I created a product configuration that was based on features that included my feature and the RCP feature. I was able to successfully export the product and all its features without problems. Just as a sanity check, I tried running the launcher and everything checked out ok. If this test case is not similiar to your problem, please let me know.
I wasn't able to reproduce this in 3.3 M6.

bug.short_desc: New folder creation from a filter shows cached information in My Home (last created folder in mine)

long_desc.thetext:
I have a filter that filters *.c named 'C Files'
Then I created a folder 'test' under that filter folder from Remote Sytems View. However, My Home view does not get refreshed correctly. It even showed previous folders which has been deleted. That means, creating a folder named 'test2' will show 'test' in My Home folder. There seems to be a caching problem here.
Target machine is a fedora core 5 on a x86. I use ssh only connection. Below description shows my VM, which I do not use for RSE Tests. -----------Enter bugs above this line----------- RSE 1.0 Testing round 2 installation : eclipse-platform-3.2.1, cdt-3.1.1 RSE install : update-site RSE-complete java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_08-b03 os.name: : Windows XP 5.1, Service Pack 2 ------------------------------------------------ systemtype : Unix-ssh (dstore-processes) targetos : FEDORA LINUX 10.1 (i586) targetuname : Linux osgiliath 2.6.16.21-0.21-default #1 Tue Aug 29 16:42:05 UTC 2006 i686 athlon i386 GNU/Linux targetvm : Sun Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_07-b03, mixed mode, sharing) ------------------------------------------------
this should be fixed now.
Fix verified in RC3 testing.

The fix for this bug only handles the "My Home" filter. Suppose "My Home" is "/home/kmunir/*". Let's say you create two filters "Home1" and "Home2", both of which point to "/home/kmunir/*". Let's say both are expanded. If you right click on one and create a folder in one, the other won't show the newly created folder.
The problem in general is that when a resource is created (file or folder), any filter that has that resource as a direct child was not being refreshed.
I fixed the problem, but I am reopening this bug so that it can be verified.
Changing status to Fixed (as noted before).

Do I understand this right:
The original fix was for "My Home" only, and the bug verification verified "My Home" only. But later, you found out that other filter types were affected as well as described in comment 3.
You fixed this additional problem for 1.0 in the process of fixing bug 161936, and the additional fix needs to be verified again.
For verifying this fix in 1.0, please test several sorts of filters, partially with multiple filter strings, showing the same set of resources then modify the resource set in one of the filters.

bug.short_desc: [Dialogs] jface Window class should provide data properties

long_desc.thetext:
User-defined dialog classes based on the Window class often need to accumulate data based on user-input, which is typically requested after a successful Window.open(). Although Window.open() returns the closing result, there exists no common interface for related user-data from the dialog and each and every dialog has to document non-generic getter methods to request these results (e.g. InputDialog has a "getValue" method). I propose to add a generic meta-data interface to either org.eclipse.jface.window.Window or org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog. Interestingly there already exists a similar interface in org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget:
public Object getData (String key); public void setData (String key, Object value);
which fulfills the above mentioned requirements. Because this interface is well-known to every SWT programmer, it would be natural to expect a similar one in the jface Window/Dialog classes.
I would like to mention that this request was inspired by a current newsgroup thread
eclipse.platform.swt, 2006-09-30 17:14 by Ali Naddaf: "How to get control values from a dialog?"
Especially Tom Schindl's answer to that question lead to this proposal.
Created an attachment (id=51621) Patch to add set/getData
Since the SWT user data fulfills your requirements, can you not just attach your dialog data to the widget data of the underlying widget?

(In reply to comment #2) AFAIK, there exist no public accessor for "the" underlying widget available in one of the base classes (Window or Dialog). I don't think that the shell is appropriate, because it is not owned by the dialog. The only option I see is the public available member buttonBar. But this is also problematic, because according to its docs "[..] null until dialog is layed out.". This is bad, because the typical use case is: 1) Create some dialog. 2) Feed the dialog with input data. At this point the "setter" activity of the proposed getData interface would be used. But buttunBar is null at this point. 3) Open the dialog. 4) Close the dialog and read data. That is, after close has been called, the data needs to be available.
This message is part of a mass update...the bug is likely legitimate, but not a priority. Marking P5. Patches would be entertained.

bug.short_desc: annotation view contents needs to be entirely driven via the annotation classes meta-data

long_desc.thetext:
Class: org.eclipse.stp.sc.jaxws.utils.JaxWsAnnotationUtils
Annotation view contents needs to be entirely driven via the annotation classes meta-data: the class JaxWsAnnotationUtils provides several methods to find the list of available annotations for the relevant java element type. Unfortunately those methods compose the list in a hard coded way.
Instead they should use the information available from the annotation definitions themselves (like the "Target" meta-annotation)
fixed by using the data from the "Target" meta-annotation from each annotation definition

bug.short_desc: changing the color of a fond is not saved

long_desc.thetext:
Open the preferences window (Window->Preferences), type "colors and fonts", and try to change the color of "Basic->TextFont" as shown in the screenshot (red, for example).
Validate with OK, and try to change the color again: the color of the selected font is black again, not red as wanted.
Created an attachment (id=51619) save the changed color don't work
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 87106 ***

attachment.desc: save the changed color don't work

bug.short_desc: [typing] IDE freeze on copy clipboard action

In the end it comes back to life, but this is quite frustrating and highly disruptive.

Dani explained it comes from import generation code. Maybe my action was actually a paste action.
Basically, had to wait 10-15 seconds, with no progress, IDE had frozen. UI thread should not wait on background DOM AST computation, which can take a while in some cases like this.
Martin, can you check whether we need to wait for the AST or whether we can life with no AST.

I believe users would complain when it becomes unpredictable if an import is added on paste or not. Note that the evaluation is on 'Copy'. Adding imports is on paste but cheap.
I'm using copy/paste all the time and never seem such a delay. I understand that this is an extra large file. At the moment I don't want to turn of essetial functionality for a corner case, but recommend users to turn the feature 'Update Imports on paste' off (Java > Editor > Typing).
Suggest to set to later.

I wouldn't turn it off either. I think it should still behave and avoid locking the IDE. This is the main issue here.
Either do it in background, or provide some progress.
Doing it in the background isn't possible here.

bug.short_desc: Parameter name is changed with data type

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce: 1.New a sample data source 2.New a data set with below query: select * from CLASSICMODELS.CUSTOMERS where CLASSICMODELS.CUSTOMERS.CUSTOMERNUMBER = ? 3.Switch to parameters in data set editor, a parameter is created automatically 4.Double click the parameter, click "..." button behind the "Linked to report parameter", note the default name of report parameter is "param1". Click "cancel" to destory "new parameter dialog" 5.Change data set paramter type to Any, and click "..." again
Expected result: Default name of report parameter is "param1"
Actual result: Default name of report parameter is changed to "NewParameter1"
When set 'any' to report parameter , convert to 'string' type. fix it.
Verified on build 20061011

bug.short_desc: Capitialising hostname letters causes problems on some characters

long_desc.thetext:
My host machine name contains letter 'i' whose capital version is 'İ' in my language settings, not 'I'. At first session, there is no problem in connection. But when you close and open eclipse again, the letter becomes '' and it is not possible to connect that machine because there is no such machine.
I did not understand why it capitalises the letters in hostname.
-----------Enter bugs above this line----------- RSE 1.0 Testing round 2 installation : eclipse-platform-3.2.1, cdt-3.1.1 RSE install : update-site RSE-complete java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_08-b03 os.name: : Windows XP 5.1, Service Pack 2 ------------------------------------------------ Target machine is a fedora core 5. I use ssh only option to connect to that machine.

Dave that's for you -- looks like we might have to switch to ICU4J sooner rather than later in order to support some non-english locales.
Another workaround might be not to capitalize the host name. Why is it capitalized after all?

IPv4 host names are case insensitive. Much data is stored using the host name as part of the key. Therefore, the host name is capitalized here so that these comparisons work naturally. This must be done using a locale (such as the US locale) the does the appropriate case mapping. See RFC1035.
This is a workaround. It is not a permanent fix. A permanent fix would store the name as typed and provide an API by which a canonical name can be retrieved, as well as an api by which the original name can be retrieved for display purposes. This is too much of an impact to fix immediately, so the workaround is used instead. We will visit this problem again after release 1.0.

FYI, I wrote some code for windriver that supports getting a canonical hostname. But I'm not sure if that's really what we want.
Users might want to specify connections for the same host slightly differently, in order to support different sorts of configuration. At which points in RSE would we want a canonical hostname, exactly?
Consider for 1.0.1

A normalized host name would be used to compare if two hosts are equal or to store attributes keyed by host name. It would not be used to actually perform the connect - the host name as entered would do that.
In the case of IP host names normalized probably means "uppercase in the US locale".
We would connect using the name as entered. We'd also try to track down all places where the host name is displayed and display it as entered rather than normalizing it on entry.
*** Bug 163723 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Comment 2 seems to indicate that some workaround was implemented in order to make this bug less severe. Is this true or am I misunderstanding?
The workaround appears to be holding its own OK. We'll revisit this for 3.0 for a permanent fix.

bug.short_desc: annotation view doesn't add import for annotation params based on enums

long_desc.thetext:
package: org.eclipse.stp.sc.jaxws.views
annotation view doesn't add import for annotation params based on enums, and put the fully qualified name of the param values in the annotation code.
i.e. @SOAPBinding(style=javax.jws.soap.SOAPBinding.Style.DOCUMENT, use=javax.jws.soap.SOAPBinding.Use.LITERAL)
the resulting generated code is too clutered. We need generated the appropriate imports and clean this up.
fixed by using the data from the meta-annotation "Target"
ouos, closed the wrong one :P

the view can now detect and manipulate annotations against method parameters. Because the JDT doesn't modelize method parameters as IMember, the view has been refactored to handle AstNodes when necessary.
damnit!!! closed the wrong one again!!
Created an attachment (id=64264) a patch for this bug
Just taking a look at this now -- I see there is an update to the deploy.emf and the example deploydriver in here too. Is that intentional, or did it sneak in from a previous workspace?

Yes, this patch also contains some updates about SOAS deploy framework. Because I forgot to contain these updates in previous patch about undeploy function, so I package these updates within this patch.
Thanks Denny!
done

bug.short_desc: The same data does not render the same chart through report design file and java file

long_desc.thetext:
The same data does not render the same chart through report design file and java file
Steps to reproduce: 1. Preview the rptdesign file 2. Run the java file
Expected result: Rendering the same chart
Actual result: The two charts are different
Created an attachment (id=51623) design file
Created an attachment (id=51624) java file
Created an attachment (id=51625) csv file
Created an attachment (id=51626) chart preview screen shot
Created an attachment (id=51627) java rendered jpg

The chart in the design file is a stacked area chart. The java file doesn't set the sub type(default is "Overlay") and mark series as stacked. So the rendered result is not a statcked area chart but an overlay area chart.
Verified, closed.

bug.short_desc: SVG:Tooltip does not work correctly when two data point are at the same point

long_desc.thetext:
Tooltip does not work correctly when two data point are at the same point
Steps to reproduce: 1. Run the attached java file 2. Move mouse over the last but two data point
Expected result: The two data point at the same point are both shown
Actual result: Only the "0" is shown
Created an attachment (id=51630) java file
Can you attach the jpeg version. I want to see if the jpeg renderer handles this problem.

Created an attachment (id=52102) design file (jpg)
It seems that the jpeg renderer does not handle this problem either.
Created an attachment (id=52103) csv file

Added david to this bug since this effects the jpeg renderer as well.
How should we handle overlapping tooltips? Should the tooltip be merged? If so how should they be merged? David do you have any comments?

This is not a bug. Showing the 0 value is expected. Other chart packages such as excel also has this problem.
If this is a hard requirement I suggest you open an enhancement for this. This enhancement should be targeted to the chart engine and not the renderer.
Verified, closed.
Closed.
